alert.note: Alert for Bryan (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 1:28PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bryan County through 215 PM CDT... At 128 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Albany, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bokchito, Bennington, and Wade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
